title: Drunk saleswoman blamed sandals for being ‘off-balance’
text:
When officer stopped Katie Leadbeater’s car near Manchester, she blamed for sandals for being off-balance (Picture: Cavendish)

A saleswoman caught drink-driving in her Ford Mustang blamed her beach sandals on the fact she was unsteady on her feet when she was pulled over.

Katie Leadbeater, 25, had swapped her stilettos for the sandals after a night out in Manchester when she was stopped on April 29.

A CCTV operator alerted police when he became concerned about how her American sports car with a personalised number plate was being driven on the outskirts of the city.

Officers noticed she was ‘off-balance’ when she got out on Chester Road, but Leadbeater blamed her footwear.

She was found to be one and a half times the drink driving limit.

Katie Leadbeater was caught drink-driving in her Ford Mustang near Manchester (Picture: Cavendish)

She has been drinking with friends in Manchester before being arrested (Picture: Cavendish)

Leadbeater, who reportedly lives in a £1 million farmhouse near Bolton, is believed to work at a Victoria Secret store at the Trafford Centre in Manchester.

Advertisement

Advertisement

At Manchester Magistrates’ Court , she pleaded guilty to drink driving and was banned from driving for 12 months.

In mitigation for Leadbeater defence lawyer Ashley Barnes told the judge: ‘The reading of 51mg is in the lower end of the spectrum but it still comes as an enormous surprise to her – although she accepts the reading.

‘You will have read she was slightly unsteady on her feet. She was driving in sliders which you wear on the beach normally.

‘She had been out somewhere nice wearing nice shoes and took them off as she did not want to drive in those nice shoes.

Katie Leadbeater leaves Manchester Magistrates Court after she was banned from driving for 12 months (Picture: Cavendish)

‘So far as any loss of balance that would be the main reason. Her income monthly will go because she lives north of Bolton and she has a job in the Trafford Centre.

‘It won’t be economically viable for her to get there and keep the job.’

Leadbeater was also fined £360 and was ordered to pay £436 in costs and surcharges.

She was also offered a chance to attend a drink driving rehabilitation course to reduce the length of her ban.
